intro: Krapovickasia physaloides, commonly known as the golden bellvile, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that resemble bells. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
